properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Mixed precipitation will affect the Outaouais and the Lachute - Saint-Jérôme region tonight. Precipitation has already begun as rain, but will change to snow over northernmost areas late this afternoon. Snow may locally change over to freezing rain late this evening or overnight. Rainfall amounts may approach 25 millimetres, except for areas farther north which could see 2 to 5 centimetres of wet, heavy snow. Light amounts of freezing precipitation are possible before precipitation comes to an end overnight tonight. Possibly heavy rain could contribute to rising water levels. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-02T03:56:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-01T19:57:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2497519640.2019
Area: Rapides-des-Joachims area, Fort William - Shawville area, Low - Wakefield area, Maniwaki - Gracefield area, Papineauville - Chénéville area, Papineau-Labelle Reserve area, Lièvre River area, Saint-Jérôme area, Lachute area, Saint-Eustache area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Additional rainfall amounts of 10 to 15 mm are expected tonight. Rain will continue into tonight. An additional 10 to 15 mm of rain are expected by Thursday morning. Locally higher rainfall amounts are possible. The ground has limited ability to absorb further rainfall. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-02T03:08:12-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Substantial high-elevation snowfall continues. Roughly 5 to 10 cm of snow is expected along the west coast today into tonight. Accumulations may reach as high as 25 cm along the highest parts of the Viking Trail between Wiltondale and Bonne Bay. Similar or higher totals are likely across higher parts of the Long Range Mountains. The snow will begin to ease tonight. Back-country trails or high-elevation roads will continue to be difficult to navigate due to the accumulating snow. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-05-02T01:59:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-01T13:26:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1689102555.2019
Area: Gros Morne, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain or freezing rain tonight. Rain will continue this evening into the overnight. There is the risk of freezing rain this evening with temperatures expected to fall to near the zero degree mark. There is also uncertainty as to how much precipitation will fall as rain or freezing rain. Current indications show that rainfall amounts of 15 to 25 mm are possible by Thursday morning. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected this evening. Rain will continue this evening before changing to freezing rain this afternoon. Freezing rain will last for several hours before changing back to rain overnight. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Town Of Zealandia
properties.Summary:
Description: A precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Zealandia. This advisory is for the entire Town of Zealandia and for any individuals who may access the Zealandia water system. This advisory is until May 6, 2019.

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continues For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre continues to issue a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-05-02T11:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-05-01T11:07:28-05:00, 56C692D6-DCD1-2ECD-37C5-E395EC5BCA0E
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts. Thunderstorms developing over the area will continue moving east early this evening. Thunderstorms will weaken this evening. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-05-02T05:54:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-01T20:47:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2129759414.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A mix of precipitation is expected over the Laurentians tonight. Snow will begin late this afternoon, then change over to rain or freezing rain this evening as temperatures drop to near the freezing mark. Accumulations of wet, heavy snow locally approaching 2 to 4 centimetres are expected this evening. Up to 5 to 10 millimetres of freezing precipitation is expected locally by late overnight tonight, especially over higher elevations. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-02T04:52:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-01T19:53:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1436535478.2019
Area: Mont-Tremblant - Sainte-Agathe area, Sainte-Adèle - Saint-Sauveur area
properties.Author: Environment Canada
